# Das Schwarzlicht-Terrarium

Das Schwarzlicht-Terrarium () is a 2000 novel by the German writer Thor Kunkel. Set in the late 1970s in the run-down Frankfurt district of Gallus, nicknamed Kamerun, it follows a number of eccentrics and petty criminals, to a backdrop of drug research and American influence. It was Kunkel's debut novel and published by Rowohlt Verlag.
A chapter from the book was awarded the  in 1999. Critics described the book as a German answer to the film Pulp Fiction.
